alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 6:20AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Monroe County through 645 AM CST... At 620 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pala Alto, or 9 miles northwest of West Point, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Aberdeen, Prairie, Hatley, Gattman, Binford, Sipsey Fork, New Hamilton, Becker, Quincy, Splunge, Wise Gap, Athens, Strong, East Aberdeen, Muldon and Greenwood Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
